animalBackground.heading: Variety in the Wild: Animals of Sri Lanka

animalIntro.heading: Indigenous animals in Sri Lanka
animalIntro.paragraph: Sri Lanka is home to a diverse array of indigenous animals, many of which are unique to the island. The rich ecosystems, ranging from dense rainforests to arid plains, provide habitats for a remarkable variety of fauna. Some notable indigenous animals include:

cardConclusion.paragraph: In conclusion, the rich biodiversity of the island is highlighted by the wide variety of native animals found in Sri Lanka, including the magnificent Sri Lankan Elephant, the elusive Purple-faced Langur, and the unusual Indian Pangolin. It is essential to preserve their habitats and put into place efficient conservation measures in order to maintain this rare species.
